turns.speaker: SALESWOMAN
turns.text: Oh, yes! It may need some slight alterations, but it is madam's size.  All right, dear.  We'll have it for you to try in a moment.

turns.speaker: SCOTTIE
turns.text: How soon can it be altered?

turns.speaker: SCOTTIE
turns.text: Can we have it by tonight?

turns.speaker: SCOTTIE
turns.text: Yes, it is. Now, I want to look at an evening dress, a dinner dress, black -- short -- long sleeves -- with a neck cut this...  ...and the skirt out.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: They'll get us on accesory to murder.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Bullshit it's not accesory. I didn't do shit. You call the cops, you explain it was an accident...

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: I'm not going to ruin my life over a dead whore.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That's a horrible ugly comment. "Dead whore?" She's a person!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We're gonna get caught. I know we're gonna get caught. They were eyeballing my car.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We're leaving from my house in three hours. If you want to come, get your numbers in order by then.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No first of all. I'm not in a game mood.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: It's really a stupid opinion. You have developed an annoying habit of talking for what seems to be no other reason than to hear yourself speak.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Because my opinion threatens yours, it's poorly developed?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No, because your opinions are idiotic and have nothing to do with what any given conversation is about, which makes 85% of your eagerly injected thought process highly offensive to me.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Oh, and why am I an asshole?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Tonight we return once again to the cave. Tonight we let the monsters out. We fill ourselves with the spirits of Genghis Khan, Joe Namath, JFK, Paton, Lombardi, Hemingway...

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: I was just playing...we were playing just playing around.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: We were playing...she slipped...she hit her head.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: The floor was wet. She slipped!

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: I don't know why the floor was wet!

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: You never were a team player. That's why you never had any friends.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: You have acquaintances - business friends and superficial golf buddies. You have always been a fringe player. You have some serious male on male intimacy problems.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: What are you fucking talking about?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Fucking Boyd. That fucking idiot. They're on to us.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: They're not on to us. I'm gonna call Boyd.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: About anybody but yourself. You never have.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: And you're a little fucking reject.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: If you ever touch my minivan again, I'll make you sorry. Real sorry.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: You got a retarded kid and a fat pig wife.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Don't you threaten me you little rat fuck.

turns.speaker: MICHEAL
turns.text: Don't you fucking threaten me - I'll fucking kill you.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Four hours and fifteen minutes. I can make Vegas in 3 and change.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: You want to hear me out?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: One idea that if you had fucking listened to, you would each be worth approximately 15 million dollars.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You can't keep bringing up Starbucks. That was your only real hit in like 75 tries.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: I set up Fisher with the broker that found his house. Took care of that one, didn't I?  Prison Communications.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Over eight years of some of the hardest raging experiences of my life.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: You don't know what you're doing.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: What do you think you are doing?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Just wait a second. Wait one second. Okay. What are you doing?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Why?  Why? She's dead. Why are you calling an ambulance?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We have to call the ambulance.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Everybody shut up. LISTEN TO ME!

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Listen to me. Please. Everybody just calm down a bit here. Okay... First...are we sure she's dead?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Her head's bashed in and her heart isn't beating.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Are you sure this was an accident?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You're a lying deviant. What did you do?!

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Stop it! Listen to me. Let's just take a second here and take hold of the situation, OK? Let's just review our options here.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We have a dead woman bleeding all over the bathroom. What options? Call the police.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Call the police. Okay, that's one option.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: That is not an "option." There is no multiple choice here.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Yes sir, there sure is an option here. There are always options.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: What were we doing officer? Why didn't we help her? Well...we're all a bit high, you know, bachelor party, that kind of thing. Fisher here is getting married in three days...Beautiful wife ...he didn't have anything at all to do with it...It was all Micheal here... just Micheal...

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Bury her out in the desert.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You don't just casually walk out of a Vegas Casino with a dead woman.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: We can do this. We can get her out of here.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Have you completely lost your mind? So you get her out of here. So you get her out into the desert somehow, without anybody seeing, so what, you don't think at some point somebody might notice that she's gone?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Nobody knows she's here. I called her personally. Nobody knows.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Her blood is all over the bathroom. I'd say that's a bit of a DNA problem.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: It's a marble floor, we can clean it up.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Her fucking head was caved in.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: So I didn't fucking do it!

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: She's got bondage burns on her wrists. There's blow all over the room, Moore looks like he went at it with a mountain lion. This room looks like the Manson Family stayed here a month. Micheal goes down, we all go down.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Wrap her up in blankets. Bring the car around to the back of the hotel, throw her off the balcony, put her in the car...Done.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You don't think someone will have a problem with a body being thrown off a balcony?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: We check out the area and wait for a time when it's clear.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Someone goes to Walmart, gets some buckets, brushes, mops, Spic and Span, the works.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Have you ever done this before?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: The reality is, you take away the horror of this situation, take away the tragedy of the death, take away the moral and ethical implications of all the crap you have had conditioned, beaten, into your head since grade one. What are we left with? What? A 115 lb. problem. 115 lbs. that must be moved from point A to point B. Now, a straight line in the shortest distance but we are denied the luxury of a visible straight line. But that line exists and I see it.I see that line. Trust me. Adam. Trust me...I can take care of this.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No, I mean the suitcases. We can't bury them in suticases.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: According to Jewish law, the blood and limbs are considered to be part of the human being. They must be buried together or their souls won't rest in peace.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No we're not. The bodies are all mixed up. We can't do this to them.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: She's Asian. They don't have Jews in Asia.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Well what the fuck are we supposed to do?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Open the suitcases, unpack the body parts and reunite the limbs.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I am not flexible on this.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Now I am the last to say that we have done here is a good thing. It's not. It's not a good thing. But it was, given the circumstances, the smart play. We did what had to be done. And...well...I'm proud of us. I'm proud of each and every one of us. We performed. Under the most complex and nerve shattering of situations, we stood fast and we delivered. I feel proud.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We are all going straight to hell. Either hell or prison, whichever comes first.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Wrong. That is flat out wrong. Hell is for cowards, for hypocrites who fear to live by the strenght of their own convictions. This is war. Given the circumstances, and given the fact that we are alive and they are not, we have chosen life over death. Two wrongs don't make a right. So our conviction and execution would only mean more death here, not less.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Boyd you idiot, the shit's coming down!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You got us into this mess.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Oh I did? I think it was your little rat fuck brother who decided to play Hamburger Helper with the hooker's head.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Would you, shush?! These phones aren't secure!

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Lighten up Adam. Show some character.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Don't talk to me about character.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Who? What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: They're on me. They're smoking me out!

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: You got some mighty fucking fine bad timing Adam. We got a rehearsal situation here.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I didn't do anything! I'll turn your pathetic ass in!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I won't calm down. I can't do this. We can't do this. It won't work. It will not work.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I'm talking about DNA samples, fiber optics, search parties, they got infrared scanners, FBI scientists. They figure this shit out. They always figure it out.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I got children. I've got a life.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: All right. Let's all go back in. Adam? You're cool right?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No. I'm not Boyd. I am not cool at all.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Honey, go in there and get some Starbursts.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: They're screaming like monsters and it's giving me a headache. Go get some fucking Starbursts.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: What do you mean? It's it's a Goddamn Mini-Mart?!

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I know you'll be.  Three hours.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: They've all been real times. And as you prepare to enter into a new phase of life, as you prepare for new roles; father, husband, teacher, you will, as I have, come to except the letting go of of old ways. Soon, the mellowing will begin...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: No. No. No. It's what my father said to me. He said it and he meant it... He said to me...He said, Adam, he said...He told me and I heard him... he said...  Hell he said so many Goddamn things I can't remember everything he said for Christsake.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Right! That's exactly what I'm saying. My father said, first of all, I'm your father not your friend. I'm your father.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Then fuck what your father said, cause I'm gonna tell you right now...You'll know what it's all about, why you got married and why you love her when you wake up at three in the morning, and the streetlight's coming through the window and it's just catching a corner of her face, like a sleeping angel. And her hair smells sweet and she's your's. She's all your's. Do you see where I'm going here?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: The bucks gonna stop right here.  If my son doesn't know the six New England states, if he has trouble with geography, I won't stick it in his face. I'll help the little guy. I'll put him in the car and take him out there. I'll take him to Maine for a big Lobster dinner, go skiing in Vermont, hot dogs at Yankee Stadium...I won't stare him down.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I tell mine that they're little men. I tell them they're strong. They make me feel joy. I let 'em know. So they really know that I need them just as much. You know. Just as much man. And you know, you're their godfather...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: If anything ever happens to me...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Y'see? That's the real point here. That's what I'm driving for, when the big storm comes and knocks down all the forests and the rocks fall down and the leave's are bare. What's left? The little trees, the little fellas that the storm didn't see. The tiny little...

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Either side you idiot. I'm calling 911.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I want you to hear me out.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: You and I have done nothing. You especially. We are innocent.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: We are. We go to the police. We tell them the truth. Now. Before they find out. Now. We save ourselves.

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: Have you thought about what I said?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Jesus Adam, can we not get into this now please?

turns.speaker: ADAM
turns.text: I got a migraine like a little monkey kicking in the side of my skull, Mike Tyson with a fucking sledge hammer trying to crack...

turns.speaker: BARRY MORRIS
turns.text: Yes money. Adam had a five hundred dollar Term Life Insurance Policy.

turns.speaker: BARRY MORRIS
turns.text: Actually, no. Adam was switching to a Whole Life Policy, but re-scheduled his medical exam...and failed to make his last payment...so his Term Life lapsed. So it's value is null and void.  Now he did have a pension account, worth another 150 thousand.

turns.speaker: BARRY MORRIS
turns.text: And a house. Valued at 350 thousand.

turns.speaker: LIZ
turns.text: Tomorrow.  We are getting married tomorrow.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: I don't understand where this personal attack is coming from...

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: You're a liar. I want to know what happened in Vegas.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I don't want to hear it from the liar. Stick a plug in it Boyd. Fisher? What happened in Vegas?

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: Micheal? Do you have something to tell me?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: He's upset about Adam. We're all upset.

turns.speaker: LOIS
turns.text: I will call the police right now if I don't start getting some answers.

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: Ah, yeah, hi. Is Tina there?

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: I'm with Tina. Is she there?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: She's here. She's just...Hold on a second.

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: Sin City. Devil's Playground. The Black Bitch. All day every day.  Where's Tina?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: She's in the bathroom...she's still working.

turns.speaker: RALPH
turns.text: I'm just gonna let her know I'm here.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: Your investment ideas never work out.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: That's the whole point. They rarely work out. But on occasion they do. And when they do, they do big.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Fine. Don't come crying to Boyd. No sir.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Jack Kerouback, Herman Melville, Henry Miller and Hunter S. Thompson. I dedicate this evening to fear and to major loathing. So from sun set to sun rise, let me be heard...

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Where do you look? What side of the neck?

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: We can take her out to Red Rock. Find some quiet place...and put her in the ground.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: The past is the past. Today is the beginning of the rest of our lives.

turns.speaker: MOORE
turns.text: Today is the best day of the rest of our lives.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: He's fine. Okay Mikey, let's go.  You guys stay here.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Tony? This is Keith Fisher. You're doing my wedding and I'm calling about the chair situation. Yeah, I'll hold.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Who's up for making some real money?

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Not really.  Yes, the Fisher wedding chairs...

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Prison Communication Systems.  An acquaintance friend of mine is professionally involved with a communications outfit in Denver that I just happen to know for a fact is about to be rewarded a very large, exclusive contract to rewire every state prison in Colorado. Yes sir.

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: No, I'm holding for Tony. In chairs. Keith Fisher. Okay.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: That would translate to government guaranteed contract in excess of 35 million dollars.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Or a stock kick of approximately 125% on shares which are currently sitting around $4.38, or, in plain English...

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: She's all your's Fish. Anything you want. Happy bachelor party.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: Well we can definitely call the police. That's an easy call. If we call the police...What happens?  They find a dead prostitute in the bathroom...They ask us...What happened? We say, ah...our friend, Micheal...  Your brother...got a little out of control...they were making love...and he got a little excited...and he, ah, sort of beat her head into the side of a toilet, while he choked her to death with a rubber hose...

turns.speaker: FISHER
turns.text: Oh for Christsake Boyd. Somebody must know she's here.

turns.speaker: BOYD
turns.text: What's insane is the fact that Micheal here put a fucking girl's head through a toilet. That's insane.
